programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 10257404, Title: Death at the Mansion: Rebecca Zahau, --- Description: Death at the Mansion: Rebecca Zahau: With Jason Benjamin, Frederick Keeve, Molly Loch, Maki Saruwatari. Experts examine the case of a woman, who was found dead, hanging naked, bound and gagged in the courtyard of her billionaire boyfriend's mansion just two days after his son suffered a fatal accident while she watched him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10257404/","name":"Death at the Mansion: Rebecca Zahau","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTI2ZTU2N2QtNDY0Ni00ZTM0LWFiZjMtYTJmNjIzMjNiOTU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTEwMTY1OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Experts examine the case of a woman, who was found dead, hanging naked, bound and gagged in the courtyard of her billionaire boyfriend's mansion just two days after his son suffered a fatal accident while she watched him.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10257404/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mrneilfrancis","dateCreated":"2020-01-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Clown Investigators.","reviewBody":"Don't waste four hours of your time. This could have been just one episode. The two rocky clown investigators seem to spend ages working out would she have tied her hands behind her back if it was suicide. That small part got stretched out for so long I lost the will to live. I did manage to watch it till the end but I can honestly say my 10-year-old would have been a better investigative supporter and probably director of this disjointed mess.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"genre":["Documentary","Crime"],"datePublished":"2019-06-01","keywords":"tv mini series","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2398956/","name":"Jason Benjamin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0444858/","name":"Frederick Keeve","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6855696/","name":"Molly Loch"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0632860/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DEATH AT THE MANSION: REBECCA ZAHAU: Final Theories","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi741325849","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDEzNWIyOGUtNzhhNy00NDIzLWI0ODEtZGFkMTYzZTcwYzM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDEzNWIyOGUtNzhhNy00NDIzLWI0ODEtZGFkMTYzZTcwYzM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"DEATH AT THE MANSION: REBECCA ZAHAU: Final Theories"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Blue Bloods: Created by Mitchell Burgess, Robin Green. With Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes, Len Cariou. Revolves around a family of New York cops." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1595859/","name":"Blue Bloods","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY0NTE1ODU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Revolves around a family of New York cops.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1595859/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"thelmalee"},"dateCreated":"2013-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoy the family dinners, and the religion (I'm not Catholic)","reviewBody":"My sister and I watch and discuss this series every Friday. We absolutely love the family dinners. So incredibly nice to see a family that all love and respect each other. Although challenges to their faith are often brought up - usually from questioning by the two sons. They make it clear that keeping faith takes work. 

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I'm looking forward to what script changes may be made - with the appointment of Bratton, our new police commissioner. 

(St. Vincent's Hospital is still open in this drama - ah, if only it were so.)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34487,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2010-09-24","keywords":"new york police department,family relationships,brother brother relationship,father daughter relationship,family of cops","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005531/","name":"Donnie Wahlberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005256/","name":"Bridget Moynahan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0261678/","name":"Will Estes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106949/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315236/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121331/","name":"Mitchell Burgess"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1053841/","name":"Robin Green"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Blue Bloods: Series","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4119967769","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"First Look Trailer for Blue Bloods"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 1595859, Title: Blue Bloods, --- Description: Blue Bloods: Created by Mitchell Burgess, Robin Green. With Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes, Len Cariou. Revolves around a family of New York cops." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1595859/","name":"Blue Bloods","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY0NTE1ODU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Revolves around a family of New York cops.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1595859/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"thelmalee","dateCreated":"2013-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoy the family dinners, and the religion (I'm not Catholic)","reviewBody":"My sister and I watch and discuss this series every Friday. We absolutely love the family dinners. So incredibly nice to see a family that all love and respect each other. Although challenges to their faith are often brought up - usually from questioning by the two sons. They make it clear that keeping faith takes work. 

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I'm looking forward to what script changes may be made - with the appointment of Bratton, our new police commissioner. 

(St. Vincent's Hospital is still open in this drama - ah, if only it were so.)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34487,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2010-09-24","keywords":"new york police department,family relationships,brother brother relationship,father daughter relationship,family of cops","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005531/","name":"Donnie Wahlberg","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005256/","name":"Bridget Moynahan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0261678/","name":"Will Estes"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106949/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315236/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121331/","name":"Mitchell Burgess","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1053841/","name":"Robin Green"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Blue Bloods: Series","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4119967769","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"First Look Trailer for Blue Bloods"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
NCIS: Los Angeles
Agenci NCIS: Los Angeles
NCIS: Los Angeles

We absolutely love the family dinners. So incredibly nice to see a family that all love and respect each other. Although challenges to their faith are often brought up - usually from questioning by the two sons. They make it clear that keeping faith takes work. 

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I'm looking forward to what script changes may be made - with the appointment of Bratton, our new police commissioner. 

(St. Vincent's Hospital is still open in this drama - ah, if only it were so.)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34487,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2010-09-24","keywords":"new york police department,family relationships,brother brother relationship,father daughter relationship,family of cops","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005531/","name":"Donnie Wahlberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005256/","name":"Bridget Moynahan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0261678/","name":"Will Estes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106949/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315236/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121331/","name":"Mitchell Burgess"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1053841/","name":"Robin Green"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Blue Bloods: Series","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4119967769","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"First Look Trailer for Blue Bloods"}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1595859, Title: Blue Bloods, --- Description: Blue Bloods: Created by Mitchell Burgess, Robin Green. With Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes, Len Cariou. Revolves around a family of New York cops." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1595859/","name":"Blue Bloods","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY0NTE1ODU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Revolves around a family of New York cops.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1595859/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"thelmalee","dateCreated":"2013-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoy the family dinners, and the religion (I'm not Catholic)","reviewBody":"My sister and I watch and discuss this series every Friday. We absolutely love the family dinners. So incredibly nice to see a family that all love and respect each other. Although challenges to their faith are often brought up - usually from questioning by the two sons. They make it clear that keeping faith takes work. 

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I'm looking forward to what script changes may be made - with the appointment of Bratton, our new police commissioner. 

(St. Vincent's Hospital is still open in this drama - ah, if only it were so.)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34487,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2010-09-24","keywords":"new york police department,family relationships,brother brother relationship,father daughter relationship,family of cops","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005531/","name":"Donnie Wahlberg","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005256/","name":"Bridget Moynahan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0261678/","name":"Will Estes"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106949/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315236/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121331/","name":"Mitchell Burgess","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1053841/","name":"Robin Green"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Blue Bloods: Series","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4119967769","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"First Look Trailer for Blue Bloods"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dans la maison
U niej w domu
Dans la maison
programme.desc: Dans la maison: Directed by François Ozon. With Fabrice Luchini, Ernst Umhauer, Kristin Scott Thomas, Emmanuelle Seigner. A high school French teacher is drawn into a precocious student's increasingly transgressive story about his relationship with a friend's family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1964624/","name":"Dans la maison","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3OTQwMTg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQ4NzAyOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A high school French teacher is drawn into a precocious student's increasingly transgressive story about his relationship with a friend's family.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1964624/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BeneCumb"},"dateCreated":"2013-11-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stylish and distinctive, with moments making you giggle","reviewBody":"This awkward and witty film is based on the play The Boy in the Last Row by Juan Mayorga, i.e. the script emanates from a solid creation. The run of the events is smooth, but sometimes it is tricky to follow the line between truth and fantasy, including the ending scenes, and some deeds remained mystery to me. In spite of serious topics touched (e.g. alienation, growing pains, loneliness, generation gaps), there are several funny scenes, particularly gallery-related ones, and strong performances provide additional value to the film (Fabrice Luchini as Germain Germain, Ernst Umhauer (skilfully depicting an 16-year-old while being 22) as Claude Garcia, Kristin Scott Thomas (in fluent French) as Jeanne Germain, Emmanuelle Seigner as Esther Artole - in particular). Hopefully, no remake will be made, as the sound of French and supposition of Frenchmen are just appropriate for such a film.\n\nRecommended to all those fond of films with twists and not afraid of subtitles.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31259,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2012-10-10","keywords":"friendship between boys,high school,literature,gay kiss,school","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2209981977","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwMTEzNzc1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjI5MTAzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwMTEzNzc1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjI5MTAzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A sixteen-year-old boy insinuates himself into the house of a fellow student from his literature class and writes about it in essays for his French teacher. programme.title: A Hologram for the King
Hologram dla króla
A Hologram for the King
programme.desc:
A Hologram for the King: Directed by Tom Tykwer. With Tom Hanks, Omar Elba, Sarita Choudhury, Sidse Babett Knudsen. A failed American sales rep looks to recoup his losses by traveling to Saudi Arabia and selling his company's product to a wealthy monarch." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2980210/","name":"A Hologram for the King","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODM3Zjk2MGYtMzNiZC00OGVhLTlhODgtYTg4NjU3NzdjYTI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjgyNjk3MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A failed American sales rep looks to recoup his losses by traveling to Saudi Arabia and selling his company's product to a wealthy monarch.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2980210/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tabuno"},"dateCreated":"2019-01-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Film Out of Our Experience","reviewBody":"25 April 2016. The title of this movie didn't help market itself unless one had already seen the movie. That's a big problem, a movie title. Subsequently though this more substantive version of Lost in Translation (2003) that includes much more of a relational component offers up a pungent and enlightening as well as dramatic collision of two cultures. Along with a nice comedic tone with dramatic and sometimes fearful moments, Holograph does nicely with sustaining the audience's interest and revealing an entertaining, intriguing storyline about a wonderful but frustrating business opportunity in Saudi Arabia. This perhaps fictional behind the scenes look at Saudi culture is fascinating and the relational story lines are also quite compelling, if not perhaps completely believable.

Unlike Slumdog Millionaire (2008), Holograph offers a duality between strikingly different cultures. Unlike Roman Holiday (1953), Holograph offers a more equitable status between characters who are more identifiable to a average American audience while at the same time highlighting the delicate and sometimes comical and serious cultural barriers. Another culture clash movie, Fear and Trembling (2003) perhaps comes closest to the revelation and exposure of the intimate dynamics of the differences in ethnic behavior and attitudes. Fear and Trembling however is much more focused as a serious cultural study whereas Holograph is more fluid and mainstream Hollywood in its presentation but in a good way.

In sum, Holograph is an insightful and delightful look into the interactions between the personal cultural differences along with a basic meaningful human sameness undertone of invaluable importance.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":42627,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2016-04-28","keywords":"backhoe,male in a shower,skin diving,overhead camera shot,cell phone","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi939767065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTUyMjY1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDg5MjAzODE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTUyMjY1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDg5MjAzODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Cultures collide when an American businessman (Tom Hanks) is sent to Saudi Arabia to close what he hopes will be the deal of a lifetime. programme.title: The Lost Son
The Lost Son
programme.desc: The Lost Son: Directed by Chris Menges. With Daniel Auteuil, Nastassja Kinski, Katrin Cartlidge, Marianne Denicourt. Xavier Lombard is a world-weary private eye in London, in exile from his native Paris; his best friend is Nathalie, a high-class call girl. He gets a call from an old friend from the Paris police department, now a businessman whose brother-in-law is missing. The missing man's parents hire Xavier over their daughter's objections, and quickly he finds himself in the realm of children's sexual slavery. He guesses that the lost son is dead and shifts his focus to finding and breaking this lucrative business of child trafficking. He involves a reluctant Nathalie to hunt "the Austrian," the shadowy head of the business. Violence erupts quickly, and Xavier soon has little more to lose." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0144286/","name":"The Lost Son","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzE5MjE2ODUwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODgwNjcxMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Xavier Lombard is a world-weary private eye in London, in exile from his native Paris; his best friend is Nathalie, a high-class call girl. programme.title: Tamtej nocy
programme.desc: Zuzanna Szwarc (Hanna Konarowska), mama kilkuletniej dziewczynki, pracuje jako kuratorka sztuki. Pewnego wieczoru widzi napad. Dwóch mężczyzna atakuje chłopaka. Zuza nie pozostaje obojętna i stara się go obronić. Kiedy na miejsce przybywa policja, to jednak ona, nie sprawcy pobicia, zostaje aresztowana.

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 1693592, Title: Vera, --- Description: Vera: With Brenda Blethyn, Jon Morrison, Riley Jones, Kenny Doughty. With her caustic wit and singular charm, DCI Vera Stanhope and her team face a series of captivating murder mysteries set against the breathtaking Northumberland landscape." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1693592/","name":"Vera","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2Q1NzhkMTQtYzVmOC00MWJiLThkNzgtYzQyMjdiNmJmMDQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjExMjk0ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"With her caustic wit and singular charm, DCI Vera Stanhope and her team face a series of captivating murder mysteries set against the breathtaking Northumberland landscape.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1693592/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"adelaidetaylor","dateCreated":"2014-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"my husband and I both are addicted to Vera's eccentricities...","reviewBody":"The plot lines always seem to grab our attention. My husband and I actually enjoy Vera's character. To me she seems like a female version of Colombo, but she is not quite as corny--instead she is more human...just as clever and determined...never giving up until she finds the killer. I think one needs to develop a taste for British detective stories (they are not nearly as "glamorous" as American whodunits) in order to enjoy watching them. We also notice the same actors appearing and reappearing in different series, inevitably playing a variety of different character types. We find British shows well-written and often more original than their American counterparts. In fact, when we started watching British shows we could barely understand the actors and now we are quite comfortable listening to British English. So many excellent shows would never be available in the US if we didn't have public broadcasting. Thank you public television for hours and hours of commercial-free entertainment and a variety of intelligent, stimulating dramas from which to choose.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10958,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2011-05-01","keywords":"forename as series title,character name as series title,one word series title,northumberland,murder mystery","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000950/","name":"Brenda Blethyn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0607201/","name":"Jon Morrison","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4474370/","name":"Riley Jones"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0269801/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Vera: Set 5","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi450474777","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzU5ZWNkNzEtNjZlOC00ZWM5LTgyOWQtMzVlMTQ5NWIwNGMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzU5ZWNkNzEtNjZlOC00ZWM5LTgyOWQtMzVlMTQ5NWIwNGMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Vera: Set 5"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Transfer kosmicznej energii
programme.desc: Radek jest ambitnym coachem motywacyjnym. Robi karierę w korporacji. Mężczyzna traci pewność siebie w momencie, gdy uczestniczy w bójce w knajpie. Decyduje się na nielegalne techniki hakowania mózgu. Niestety rezultaty są inne, niż się spodziewał.

credits.actor: Adam Turczyk
Dorota Androsz

programme.title: Ewolucja Jackiego Chana
programme.desc: Kulisy spektakularnej kariery Jackiego Chana. Tego znanego artystę można nazwać człowiekiem instytucją. Oprócz tego że jest cenionym aktorem, pracuje także jako kaskader, scenarzysta i reżyser, a także biznesmen. Jak nikt inny w branży filmowej potrafi widowiskowo łączyć azjatyckie kino sztuk walki z chaplinowskim humorem oraz hollywoodzkim rozmachem.

programme.title: To, co zostaje
programme.desc: Marianna (Marta Ścisłowicz) i Jan (Piotr Czarniecki) wiodą szczęśliwe życie na wsi w północno-wschodniej Polsce. Pewnego dnia kobieta musi stawić czoła niespodziewanej śmierci męża. Wyrzuty sumienia i nagła strata sprawiają, że potrzebuje czasu, żeby pożegnać ukochanego. Zamyka się z jego ciałem w domu. Jej zachowanie spotyka się z niezrozumieniem mieszkańców wioski.

credits.actor: Marta Ścisłowicz
Piotr Czarniecki
Michał Jaros
Elżbieta Studniarek
Natan Kryczyński

programme.title: Coco avant Chanel
Coco Chanel
Coco avant Chanel
programme.desc:
Coco avant Chanel: Directed by Anne Fontaine. With Audrey Tautou, Benoît Poelvoorde, Alessandro Nivola, Marie Gillain. The story of Coco Chanel's rise from obscure beginnings to the heights of the fashion world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1035736/","name":"Coco avant Chanel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA0NjYzMzQxNzBeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDI2MDA0ODI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Coco Chanel's rise from obscure beginnings to the heights of the fashion world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1035736/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Hannah_Winter"},"dateCreated":"2009-05-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautifully made","reviewBody":"It may be a subject that will not automatically appeal to many. However, this movie is certainly worth watching.

Audrey Tautou, complete with all the mannerisms and dark looks of Coco Chanel, plays a magnificent role. We start of at the miserable beginning of Gabrielle Chanel's life, in an orphanage. It quickly becomes clear that this is not the story about some high-society woman who got bored and decided to make clothes in a style that was unheard of at that time, even for people who don't know anything about the life of Coco Chanel. We see her, slowly but surely, clawing her way up in society, using her charm and wit, but most of all: her outspokenness, always telling what she thinks.

Cinematographically, this film is outstanding too. Throughout the film, certain elements of clothing (black and white patterns, stripes, men's shirts) are shown through an unclear lens, to point out that even the most early views of Coco on fashion were incorporated in her style later.

This film is not just a story about Coco's success, it's also about her struggle to fit in in a society that differed so much from her own opinions, about her losses and heartaches. All in all, we get a complete picture of the icon that is still loved and admired today.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":39646,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2009-04-22","keywords":"life of celebrity before becoming famous,social status,1920s,beach,wealth","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2992290329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTY0ODg1MTUtODNmNC00ZDUzLWI3YzEtNWU1OGM2ODNiZmQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTY0ODg1MTUtODNmNC00ZDUzLWI3YzEtNWU1OGM2ODNiZmQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851582/","name":"Audrey Tautou"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0688143/","name":"Benoît Poelvoorde"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0284774/","name":"Anne Fontaine"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030799/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254563/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1212643/","name":"Edmonde Charles-Roux"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0284774/","name":"Anne Fontaine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1597664/","name":"Camille Fontaine"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1035736, Title: Coco avant Chanel, --- Description: Coco avant Chanel: Directed by Anne Fontaine. With Audrey Tautou, Benoît Poelvoorde, Alessandro Nivola, Marie Gillain. The story of Coco Chanel's rise from obscure beginnings to the heights of the fashion world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1035736/","name":"Coco avant Chanel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA0NjYzMzQxNzBeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDI2MDA0ODI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Coco Chanel's rise from obscure beginnings to the heights of the fashion world.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1035736/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Hannah_Winter","dateCreated":"2009-05-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautifully made","reviewBody":"It may be a subject that will not automatically appeal to many. However, this movie is certainly worth watching.

Audrey Tautou, complete with all the mannerisms and dark looks of Coco Chanel, plays a magnificent role. We start of at the miserable beginning of Gabrielle Chanel's life, in an orphanage. It quickly becomes clear that this is not the story about some high-society woman who got bored and decided to make clothes in a style that was unheard of at that time, even for people who don't know anything about the life of Coco Chanel. We see her, slowly but surely, clawing her way up in society, using her charm and wit, but most of all: her outspokenness, always telling what she thinks.

Cinematographically, this film is outstanding too. Throughout the film, certain elements of clothing (black and white patterns, stripes, men's shirts) are shown through an unclear lens, to point out that even the most early views of Coco on fashion were incorporated in her style later.

This film is not just a story about Coco's success, it's also about her struggle to fit in in a society that differed so much from her own opinions, about her losses and heartaches. All in all, we get a complete picture of the icon that is still loved and admired today.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":39646,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2009-04-22","keywords":"life of celebrity before becoming famous,social status,1920s,beach,wealth","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2992290329","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTY0ODg1MTUtODNmNC00ZDUzLWI3YzEtNWU1OGM2ODNiZmQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTY0ODg1MTUtODNmNC00ZDUzLWI3YzEtNWU1OGM2ODNiZmQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851582/","name":"Audrey Tautou","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0688143/","name":"Benoît Poelvoorde","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0284774/","name":"Anne Fontaine"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030799/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254563/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1212643/","name":"Edmonde Charles-Roux","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0284774/","name":"Anne Fontaine","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1597664/","name":"Camille Fontaine"],"duration":"PT1H45M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wojowniczka
Pompon Girl
programme.desc: Ava (Pénélope-Rose Léveque) pracuje jako klaun. Jest zabawna oraz pewna siebie. Pewnej nocy, kiedy wraca do domu z burleskowego show ze swoimi przyjaciółmi, napotkany mężczyzna prowokuje ich i obraża. Dziewczyna postanawia się bronić. Odpowiada na zaczepki napastnika. W wyniku konfrontacji zostaje pobita. Twierdzi, że wszystko jest w porządku aż do momentu, gdy dowiaduje się o czymś ważnym - podczas ataku była w ciąży.

programme.title: Secretary
Sekretarka
Secretary
programme.desc:
Secretary: Directed by Steven Shainberg. With James Spader, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Jeremy Davies, Lesley Ann Warren. A young woman, recently released from a mental hospital, gets a job as a secretary to a demanding lawyer, where their employer-employee relationship turns into a sexual, sadomasochistic one." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0274812/","name":"Secretary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmY1MTdiMDUtYzU4Ny00NWY0LTk2YjctMWU3ZTUxZjg1OTE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxMTY0OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young woman, recently released from a mental hospital, gets a job as a secretary to a demanding lawyer, where their employer-employee relationship turns into a sexual, sadomasochistic one.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0274812/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Danny_G13"},"dateCreated":"2003-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Intriguing story","reviewBody":"Secretary is the first of its kind - a very dark love story. First of its kind in that it deals with themes never seen before seen in mainstream Hollywood cinema - S&M, sexual dominance and submission.

Maggie Gyllenhaal is outstanding in a potential minefield of a role - she handles it with dignity and even provides some effective dark humour.

 The story here is that her character, Lee, applies for a job as a secretary for the firm owned by James Spader's brilliant Mr Grey. However, Lee has a history of self-harm and masochism and Grey has a dominance complex along with a very sadistic streak. Combine these 2 in theory and you have 2 very happy people. But this is no ordinary love story...

Spader, as stated, is brilliant. He brings an icy steel to the troubled Grey, but also provides a touch of black humour which comes at some great moments to 'release the tension'.

For the themes supplied here you'd probably expect a lot of raunchiness - well there are sexual moments, of course, but there is nothing gratuitous, which is in itself an achievement and well handled.

Overall it's quirky, off-beat, and a little bit different.

Worth a view."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":87976,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2002-10-11","keywords":"secretary,bdsm,submissive woman,pantyhose,sexual role playing","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Secretary","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2232746777","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGFmNzcxMTUtMTRmNy00MTg0LTk5NjItMjNjMjM5MGU2NTMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpoYW5uYXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGFmNzcxMTUtMTRmNy00MTg0LTk5NjItMjNjMjM5MGU2NTMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpoYW5uYXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Lionsgate"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000652/","name":"James Spader"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350454/","name":"Maggie Gyllenhaal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001111/","name":"Jeremy Davies"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0787601/","name":"Steven Shainberg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0080007/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033548/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114931/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933379/","name":"Erin Cressida Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1122344/","name":"Mary Gaitskill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0787601/","name":"Steven Shainberg"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0274812, Title: Secretary, --- Description: Secretary: Directed by Steven Shainberg. With James Spader, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Jeremy Davies, Lesley Ann Warren. A young woman, recently released from a mental hospital, gets a job as a secretary to a demanding lawyer, where their employer-employee relationship turns into a sexual, sadomasochistic one." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0274812/","name":"Secretary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmY1MTdiMDUtYzU4Ny00NWY0LTk2YjctMWU3ZTUxZjg1OTE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxMTY0OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young woman, recently released from a mental hospital, gets a job as a secretary to a demanding lawyer, where their employer-employee relationship turns into a sexual, sadomasochistic one.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0274812/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Danny_G13","dateCreated":"2003-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Intriguing story","reviewBody":"Secretary is the first of its kind - a very dark love story. First of its kind in that it deals with themes never seen before seen in mainstream Hollywood cinema - S&M, sexual dominance and submission.

Maggie Gyllenhaal is outstanding in a potential minefield of a role - she handles it with dignity and even provides some effective dark humour.

 The story here is that her character, Lee, applies for a job as a secretary for the firm owned by James Spader's brilliant Mr Grey. However, Lee has a history of self-harm and masochism and Grey has a dominance complex along with a very sadistic streak. Combine these 2 in theory and you have 2 very happy people. But this is no ordinary love story...

Spader, as stated, is brilliant. He brings an icy steel to the troubled Grey, but also provides a touch of black humour which comes at some great moments to 'release the tension'.

For the themes supplied here you'd probably expect a lot of raunchiness - well there are sexual moments, of course, but there is nothing gratuitous, which is in itself an achievement and well handled.

Overall it's quirky, off-beat, and a little bit different.

Worth a view.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":87976,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2002-10-11","keywords":"secretary,bdsm,submissive woman,pantyhose,sexual role playing","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Secretary","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2232746777","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGFmNzcxMTUtMTRmNy00MTg0LTk5NjItMjNjMjM5MGU2NTMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpoYW5uYXk@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGFmNzcxMTUtMTRmNy00MTg0LTk5NjItMjNjMjM5MGU2NTMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpoYW5uYXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Lionsgate","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000652/","name":"James Spader","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350454/","name":"Maggie Gyllenhaal","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001111/","name":"Jeremy Davies"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0787601/","name":"Steven Shainberg"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0080007/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033548/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114931/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933379/","name":"Erin Cressida Wilson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1122344/","name":"Mary Gaitskill","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0787601/","name":"Steven Shainberg"],"duration":"PT1H47M"</script><metacontent="

Niepokonany
Pit Fighter
programme.desc:
Pit Fighter: Directed by Jesse V. Johnson. With Dominiquie Vandenberg, Steven Bauer, Fernando Carrillo, Stephen Graham. Jack Severino has no memory, all he knows is the brutal sport of Pit Fighting. When his past catches him up, he realizes he is not who he thought he was. For some men must fight for redemption." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0396096/","name":"Pit Fighter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWI4MWYwODAtMWE3MS00ZDg3LWEyM2ItNmYxZGU0MGM2YTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5Nzc4MDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jack Severino has no memory, all he knows is the brutal sport of Pit Fighting. When his past catches him up, he realizes he is not who he thought he was. For some men must fight for redemption.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0396096/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"movieman_kev"},"dateCreated":"2005-06-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"impressive","reviewBody":"Jack (Dominique Vandenberg) gets amnesia after a bullet in the head almost kills him. Five years later, still haunted by dreams and visions of a woman he loved in his previous life even while attempting to stay the top pit fighter, his past catches up to him. However he might not like what he remembers. Writer/Director Jesse Johnson made a film that looked significantly better then his meager budget would suggest. The fights are pretty brutal and well choreographed. The story while not the most original one is serviceable enough and while this is the sole film that I've seen or heard of Dominique Vandenberg, I can already tell that a more interesting actor to watch then, say, Don "the Dragon' Wilson. Now on to hunting down Vandenberg's "The Honorable" which I've heard great things about. the film is not without a few flaws, but I found it entertaining even if the ending comes across as more than a tad bit silly. Oh and Steven Bauer's the best he's been since "Gleaming the Cube" in this one.

My Grade: B-

He soon discovers what he is hunting might not be human." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105459/","name":"Split Second","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2I2ZjBmMWEtMTVkZC00OTVkLWE1MjktOTc0MDgwNzZhYmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a flooded future London, Detective Harley Stone hunts a serial killer who murdered his partner, and has haunted him ever since. He soon discovers what he is hunting might not be human.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105459/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"megoobee"},"dateCreated":"2005-03-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fun movie","reviewBody":"Yes, it's another futuristic doom and gloom type story and yes, the story is a little thin but it's fun regardless. I don't know if they meant for it to be a comedy but it's hilarious. Keep an eye and ear out for the one liners that are randomly tossed around during the course of the movie. You can't help but feel for the poor police chief. They didn't give him much to work with but he plays his role great. The way pre "Sex and the City" Kim Cattrall's acting is pretty bad but for this movie, passable. If you are looking for mindless entertainment and don't mind profanity, this is your type of movie. The Godfather: Part III: Directed by Francis Ford Coppola. With Al Pacino, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, Andy Garcia. Follows Michael Corleone, now in his 60s, as he seeks to free his family from crime and find a suitable successor to his empire." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0099674/","name":"The Godfather: Part III","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWFlYWY2YjYtNjdhNi00MzVlLTg2MTMtMWExNzg4NmM5NmEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDk5Mzc5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows Michael Corleone, now in his 60s, as he seeks to free his family from crime and find a suitable successor to his empire.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0099674/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unjustily Criticized","reviewBody":"I stayed away from this film for a long time, doing a dumb thing: listening to the well-known film critics.

When I finally got around to it, I was very surprised. It was a good film. Not great, not intense as the first two Godfather flicks, but definitely a lot better than advertised.

Many people said this was filled with anti-Roman Catholic propaganda, but I didn't it find that way. Yes, the "Vatican bank," whatever that is, was portrayed as not on the up-and-up, but it was a little confusing to follow, maybe too confusing to get offended! Actually, there were some positive things, religious-wise, with Al Pacino's character, who sought forgiveness for his past sins and made a few very profound statements such as, "What good is confession if it isn't followed by repentance?"

Anyway, Pacino's acting talents are the main attraction in the lower-key, more cerebral Godfather film. There isn't that much action but when it occurs, it's pretty violent. As with the other two films in the series, it's nicely photographed with a lot of nice brown tints.

Finally, director-writer Francis Ford Coppola took a lot of flak for putting his daughter in such an important role but I thought she (Sofia Coppola) was fine and - like this film - unfairly criticized.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":374624,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1990-12-25","keywords":"opera,gangster,catholic church,violence,organized crime","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1237827865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDYyZmQyMjMtMGQyMS00YjYwLWIxZWEtMzQ0ODNlYzFkM2YyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDYyZmQyMjMtMGQyMS00YjYwLWIxZWEtMzQ0ODNlYzFkM2YyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"See the never-before-seen version of the final film, The #GodfatherCoda: The Death of Michael Corleone. Newly re-edited with restored picture and sound, experience the filmmaker’s true vision for the conclusion of the most celebrated saga in cinema history. In select theaters starting December 4."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000473/","name":"Diane Keaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000412/","name":"Andy Garcia"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000338/","name":"Francis Ford Coppola"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035894/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0701374/","name":"Mario Puzo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000338/","name":"Francis Ford Coppola"}],"duration":"PT2H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Driving Lessons
Nauka jazdy
Driving Lessons
programme.desc:
Driving Lessons: Directed by Jeremy Brock. With Rupert Grint, Fay Cohen, Ruby Mortlock, Don Wetherhead. A coming of age story about a shy teenage boy trying to escape from the influence of his domineering mother. His world changes when he begins to work for a retired actress." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0446687/","name":"Driving Lessons","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg4NzE5MDE3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDgxNjgzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A coming of age story about a shy teenage boy trying to escape from the influence of his domineering mother. His world changes when he begins to work for a retired actress.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0446687/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"adam_bloodworth"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Moral and highly enjoyable","reviewBody":""Driving Lessons" sees two middle class quintessential British families meet head on, when Grint's character comes into contact with Evee, (Walters), a slightly deranged out-of-touch actress with an ego. Grint betrays his overpowering, and over-Christian mother, (Linney), and goes off travelling with Evee to Scotland, to accompany her on a trip to participate in a Poetry reading, something she claims could be her last, due to an illness.

Grint's portrayal of a caged youngster, brainwashed by an overbearing, and even hypocritical mother, is the masterpiece of this film. His portrayal of a downtrodden teen in search of his true morals, and happiness, is captivating to watch unfold throughout. The film is sharply shot, and well paced, with very few moments leaving you tired, an achievement, particularly considering the nature of the plot. Walters really grabs hold of her character with both hands, and successfully brings the audience to her side of things, emphasising Linney's ironic immorality throughout. Her role in "Driving Lessons" is enjoyable and memorable in every sense.

The plot develops nicely, leaving the audience cheering on Grint as he chases back to Evee's place during his lunch break during his stint at a local bookshop to apologise for his wrongdoings. The values in the piece are continued and brought out thoroughly up until the final drag, in a very consistent way. The overbearing, (and relieving), main idea being that religion doesn't lead to happiness, and certainly doesn't lead to morality.

The audience are left sympathising with the radical but lovable Evee, with her and Grint making an irresistible partnership on the big screen, transferred directly from their debut in the "Harry Potter" series. Charismatic and beautiful acting together with a tight and fact paced script make this a must-see this Christmas.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10749,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2006-07-13","keywords":"united kingdom,driving,car,automobile,citroen","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Driving Lessons","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1369702681","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTMwYzRiYzQtMmZlMC00YmU2LWIxY2QtM2YwMjBiNThkNDgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTMwYzRiYzQtMmZlMC00YmU2LWIxY2QtM2YwMjBiNThkNDgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342488/","name":"Rupert Grint"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001473/","name":"Laura Linney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0910278/","name":"Julie Walters"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0110591/","name":"Jeremy Brock"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031020/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0146540/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104811/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0110591/","name":"Jeremy Brock"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Winning Season
Zwycięski sezon
The Winning Season
programme.desc:
The Winning Season: Directed by Jim Strouse. With Sam Rockwell, Emma Roberts, Rob Corddry, Emily Rios. A comedy centered on a has-been coach who is given a shot at redemption when he's asked to run his local high school's girls basketball team." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1293842/","name":"The Winning Season","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMwMzkwODE3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDY3MTE3Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A comedy centered on a has-been coach who is given a shot at redemption when he's asked to run his local high school's girls basketball team.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1293842/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sundevil27"},"dateCreated":"2009-01-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's a Winner!","reviewBody":"Just got back from seeing the premiere of The Winning Season at Sundance 09' and couldn't be more thrilled to report back that we have a winner.

The basic elements of the story are familiar; down in out coach finds a second chance with a bunch of scrubs and you know the rest. The Winning Season isn't groundbreakingly different from its ancestors, but just enough in all the right places to make this "dramedy" a very rewarding viewing. Audiences familiar with typical indie fare, will find that The Winning Season is indeed cut from an indie mold. The Winning Season does not gloss over the coach's failures, his abusiveness or the realities of the steep obstacles he faces. This is a good thing though, because being able to see the dark nature of the human condition makes the successes all that much more enjoyable. The strength of the The Winning Season is in its balances and ultimately the director/writers decision to allow humor and healing to be the driving force as the movie plays out. Far too often indie films allow their depressive themes to run rampant in what appears to be an effort to increase anti-depressant sales. There a lot of folks who think of any movie labeled as a "dramedy" to be fluff or mainstream box office disguising itself as an indie movie, but I would beg to differ. There is always room for reality and laughter to co-exist in a uniquely indie vision, and in the end movies should be allowed to make the viewer feel rewarded. The Winning Season aims to do that, and it's pretty much hit that mark.

On to the cast, Sam Rockwell (always underrated) is right on the money with his performance that never waivers from the lead characters self destructive nature as well as delivering such wonderfully dry humor that you keep thinking to yourself why isn't this guy getting more credit for being such a great actor. The young women in the film who make up the team are terrific and give such a sweetness to each of their roles, Emma Roberts in particular is fantastically clever in her role. Also, what a bonus to have Rob Coddry of Daily Show fame, as the goofy principle he just adds the right comedic touches to the scenes between he and Rockwell. Finally James Strouse, coming off two other well received Sundance films, ups his game here and brings a very strong effort. He should have very little problem getting more gigs with this type of quality output.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6541,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Sport"],"datePublished":"2009-01-19","keywords":"basketball,coach,high school,athlete,team","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Winning Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4091872793","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTU2NDc5MjkwOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTg1NjYyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTU2NDc5MjkwOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTg1NjYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A comedy centered on a has-been coach who is given a shot at redemption when he's asked to run his local high school's girls basketball team."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005377/","name":"Sam Rockwell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731075/","name":"Emma Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1117791/","name":"Rob Corddry"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475479/","name":"Jim Strouse"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113146/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0156663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0305313/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475479/","name":"Jim Strouse"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

A comedy centered on a has-been coach who is given a shot at redemption when he's asked to run his local high school's girls basketball team." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1293842/","name":"The Winning Season","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMwMzkwODE3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDY3MTE3Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A comedy centered on a has-been coach who is given a shot at redemption when he's asked to run his local high school's girls basketball team.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1293842/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"sundevil27","dateCreated":"2009-01-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's a Winner!","reviewBody":"Just got back from seeing the premiere of The Winning Season at Sundance 09' and couldn't be more thrilled to report back that we have a winner.

The basic elements of the story are familiar; down in out coach finds a second chance with a bunch of scrubs and you know the rest. The Winning Season isn't groundbreakingly different from its ancestors, but just enough in all the right places to make this "dramedy" a very rewarding viewing. Audiences familiar with typical indie fare, will find that The Winning Season is indeed cut from an indie mold. The Winning Season does not gloss over the coach's failures, his abusiveness or the realities of the steep obstacles he faces. This is a good thing though, because being able to see the dark nature of the human condition makes the successes all that much more enjoyable. The strength of the The Winning Season is in its balances and ultimately the director/writers decision to allow humor and healing to be the driving force as the movie plays out. Far too often indie films allow their depressive themes to run rampant in what appears to be an effort to increase anti-depressant sales. There a lot of folks who think of any movie labeled as a "dramedy" to be fluff or mainstream box office disguising itself as an indie movie, but I would beg to differ. There is always room for reality and laughter to co-exist in a uniquely indie vision, and in the end movies should be allowed to make the viewer feel rewarded. The Winning Season aims to do that, and it's pretty much hit that mark.

On to the cast, Sam Rockwell (always underrated) is right on the money with his performance that never waivers from the lead characters self destructive nature as well as delivering such wonderfully dry humor that you keep thinking to yourself why isn't this guy getting more credit for being such a great actor. The young women in the film who make up the team are terrific and give such a sweetness to each of their roles, Emma Roberts in particular is fantastically clever in her role. Also, what a bonus to have Rob Coddry of Daily Show fame, as the goofy principle he just adds the right comedic touches to the scenes between he and Rockwell. Finally James Strouse, coming off two other well received Sundance films, ups his game here and brings a very strong effort. programme.title: Daylight
Tunel
Daylight
programme.desc:
Daylight: Directed by Rob Cohen. With Sylvester Stallone, Amy Brenneman, Viggo Mortensen, Dan Hedaya. Disaster in a New York tunnel as explosions collapse both ends of it. One hero tries to help the people inside find their way to safety." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116040/","name":"Daylight","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE5MDkxYzktODU4OS00Yjc4LTk5MjktYzlkY2RjMGVlNjU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDc2NjEyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Disaster in a New York tunnel as explosions collapse both ends of it. One hero tries to help the people inside find their way to safety.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116040/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michaelsibley416"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of Sly's best performances","reviewBody":"Fasten your seatbelts and brace yourself for an non-stop thrill ride that will have you holding your breath from start to finish.

"Daylight" is one of the most intense movies I have seen in a long time. Sylvester Stallone gives one of his best performances in "Daylight" leading a group of civilians to safety after a New York tunnel engulfs in flames. Stallone works his magic as a former EMS chief sent in to save these civilians.

When I heard Stallone's name mentioned as part of the cast of "Daylight," I knew it would be a non-stop thrill ride; however, what I didn't realize it would be a thriller that had depth mixed in with everything else. "Daylight" is a credit to Stallone's ability and this remains one of his best roles to date.

Adding to this awesome film are Stallone's co-stars, which include Amy Brenneman, Viggo Mortensen, Jay O. Sanders and Stan Shaw. I enjoyed watching this ensemble work together because they seem to need no direction when on screen. It was as if they were really trapped in the tunnel. From the fear to the heroic actions they took, these actors were top notch.

Despite most thrillers, "Daylight" stands out as being the finest assembled film. The casting works like magic, the special effects are magnificent and the script is perfect.

I concede that "Daylight" is predictable. However, I disagree with those who say it hurts the film. My point is it doesn't matter whether a film is predictable, rather how it is presented. "Daylight" is presented with quite unique special effects, a plot with depth and endearing performances.

In addition to the excellent performances, "Daylight" had some of the best special effects I have seen. The explosion at the beginning of the movie was a work of art. I was in awe of how well the special effects were pulled off because I don't believe that "Daylight" would have worked as well as it did if they were done with less than 100 percent effort.

"Daylight" will keep you on the edge of your seat and have you holding your breath hoping these citizens come out alive."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70794,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1996-12-06","keywords":"collapsing tunnel,electronic music score,blowout,pistol,director cameo","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000312/","name":"Amy Brenneman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001557/","name":"Viggo Mortensen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003418/","name":"Rob Cohen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062608/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092018/","name":"Leslie Bohem"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hudson Hawk
Hudson Hawk
programme.desc:
Hudson Hawk: Directed by Michael Lehmann. With Bruce Willis, Danny Aiello, Andie MacDowell, James Coburn. A cat burglar is forced to steal Da Vinci works of art for a world domination plot." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0102070/","name":"Hudson Hawk","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc3OGExYzYtMGE0NS00YmVlLWEzOWQtNTZiMjkxZWMzYzQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A cat burglar is forced to steal Da Vinci works of art for a world domination plot.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0102070/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"slightlymad22"},"dateCreated":"2015-01-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"You Will Either Love It Or Hate It","reviewBody":"Hudson Hawk has the dubious distinction of being the final film produced by TriStar Pictures prior to their being bought out by the Sony Corporation and merged with Columbia Pictures. 

Plot In A Paragraph: Hudson Hawk, the worlds greatest cat burglar, has just been released from prison in New York. He is immediately blackmailed in to stealing some of Da Vinci's finest work in order to aid a world domination plot. 

Bruce Willis gives one of his worst performances as Eddie Hawkins/Hudson Hawk, likewise Danny Aiello is not up to his usual standard as Tommy Hawks best mate, Andie MacDowell is very blah as Anna, Hawks love interest. David Caruso and Frank Stallone are both fine in their supporting roles. However Sandra Bernhard and Richard E. Grant are simply awful. Cringeworthy bad. They ruin EVERY scene they are in. 

The movie doesn't seem to know what it wants to be, a slapstick comedy or an action adventure, and sadly ends up being neither. 

One thing I did like was a running joke in the movie that has Hudson and his partner Tommy (Aiello) singing songs concurrently but separately, to time and synchronize their exploits. Willis-Aiello duets of Bing Crosby's "Swinging on a Star" and Paul Anka's "Side by Side" are a bit of fun in an otherwise mixed bag.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":54373,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1991-05-24","keywords":"time bomb,neo screwball comedy,worst picture razzie winner,character name as title,getting out of jail","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hudson Hawk","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2224029977","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjk5MWQyZjktYmYwOS00MjNkLWFlMTUtNGY4ZjBjYTk1MDVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjk5MWQyZjktYmYwOS00MjNkLWFlMTUtNGY4ZjBjYTk1MDVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000246/","name":"Bruce Willis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000732/","name":"Danny Aiello"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000510/","name":"Andie MacDowell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0499724/","name":"Michael Lehmann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019968/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0061794/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000246/","name":"Bruce Willis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0469234/","name":"Robert Kraft"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0211823/","name":"Steven E. de Souza"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
Fear the Walking Dead
Fear the Walking Dead

programme.title: Mama
programme.desc: Lilly i Victoria znikają w tajemniczych okolicznościach tuż po tym, jak ich matka zostaje zamordowana. Wujek sióstr Lucas (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) wraz z narzeczoną Annabel (Jessica Chastain) rozpoczyna poszukiwania. Dziewczynki udaje się odnaleźć dopiero po pięciu latach. Lucas i Annabel zabierają je do siebie. Odtąd w ich domu zaczynają dziać się niepokojące rzeczy.

programme.title: Pakt z diabłem
programme.desc: Przystojny Louis (Ethan Erickson) pracuje w znanym studiu fotograficznym prowadzonym przez Bae (Jennifer Nitsch). Jego urodę dostrzega menedżer Henry (Malcolm McDowell) i zaprasza go na sesję. Za jego namową chłopak przyjmuje pseudonim artystyczny Dorian, na cześć tytułowej postaci z powieści Oscara Wilde'a "Portret Doriana Graya". Zaczyna odnosić liczne sukcesy. Po kilku latach Louis odkrywa, że twarz na przedstawiającym go portrecie starzeje się zamiast niego, podobnie jak w książce.

programme.title: Driving Lessons
Nauka jazdy
Driving Lessons
programme.desc:
Driving Lessons: Directed by Jeremy Brock. With Rupert Grint, Fay Cohen, Ruby Mortlock, Don Wetherhead. A coming of age story about a shy teenage boy trying to escape from the influence of his domineering mother. His world changes when he begins to work for a retired actress." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0446687/","name":"Driving Lessons","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg4NzE5MDE3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDgxNjgzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A coming of age story about a shy teenage boy trying to escape from the influence of his domineering mother. His world changes when he begins to work for a retired actress.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0446687/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"adam_bloodworth"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Moral and highly enjoyable","reviewBody":""Driving Lessons" sees two middle class quintessential British families meet head on, when Grint's character comes into contact with Evee, (Walters), a slightly deranged out-of-touch actress with an ego. Grint betrays his overpowering, and over-Christian mother, (Linney), and goes off travelling with Evee to Scotland, to accompany her on a trip to participate in a Poetry reading, something she claims could be her last, due to an illness.

Grint's portrayal of a caged youngster, brainwashed by an overbearing, and even hypocritical mother, is the masterpiece of this film. His portrayal of a downtrodden teen in search of his true morals, and happiness, is captivating to watch unfold throughout. The film is sharply shot, and well paced, with very few moments leaving you tired, an achievement, particularly considering the nature of the plot. Walters really grabs hold of her character with both hands, and successfully brings the audience to her side of things, emphasising Linney's ironic immorality throughout. Her role in "Driving Lessons" is enjoyable and memorable in every sense.

The plot develops nicely, leaving the audience cheering on Grint as he chases back to Evee's place during his lunch break during his stint at a local bookshop to apologise for his wrongdoings. The values in the piece are continued and brought out thoroughly up until the final drag, in a very consistent way. The overbearing, (and relieving), main idea being that religion doesn't lead to happiness, and certainly doesn't lead to morality.

The audience are left sympathising with the radical but lovable Evee, with her and Grint making an irresistible partnership on the big screen, transferred directly from their debut in the "Harry Potter" series. Charismatic and beautiful acting together with a tight and fact paced script make this a must-see this Christmas.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10749,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2006-07-13","keywords":"united kingdom,driving,car,automobile,citroen","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Driving Lessons","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1369702681","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTMwYzRiYzQtMmZlMC00YmU2LWIxY2QtM2YwMjBiNThkNDgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTMwYzRiYzQtMmZlMC00YmU2LWIxY2QtM2YwMjBiNThkNDgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342488/","name":"Rupert Grint"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001473/","name":"Laura Linney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0910278/","name":"Julie Walters"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0110591/","name":"Jeremy Brock"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031020/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0146540/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104811/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0110591/","name":"Jeremy Brock"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

The overbearing, (and relieving), main idea being that religion doesn't lead to happiness, and certainly doesn't lead to morality.

The audience are left sympathising with the radical but lovable Evee, with her and Grint making an irresistible partnership on the big screen, transferred directly from their debut in the "Harry Potter" series. Charismatic and beautiful acting together with a tight and fact paced script make this a must-see this Christmas.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10749,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2006-07-13","keywords":"united kingdom,driving,car,automobile,citroen","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Driving Lessons","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1369702681","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTMwYzRiYzQtMmZlMC00YmU2LWIxY2QtM2YwMjBiNThkNDgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTMwYzRiYzQtMmZlMC00YmU2LWIxY2QtM2YwMjBiNThkNDgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342488/","name":"Rupert Grint","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001473/","name":"Laura Linney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0910278/","name":"Julie Walters"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0110591/","name":"Jeremy Brock"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031020/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0146540/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104811/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0110591/","name":"Jeremy Brock"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="
