programme.title: The Commons
The Commons
The Commons
programme.desc: The Commons: With Joanne Froggatt, Rupert Penry-Jones, David Lyons, Ryan Corr. Set in a gripping vision of the near future, THE COMMONS is an absorbing character-driven relationship drama and a story about motherhood as the ultimate act of faith in humanity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt11324616/","name":"The Commons","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNhYTdjMDQtOWE4YS00OTdhLTk3NGEtMDc0MGQwMzk3MjAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTE1NjY5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in a gripping vision of the near future, THE COMMONS is an absorbing character-driven relationship drama and a story about motherhood as the ultimate act of faith in humanity.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11324616/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"geeztell"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent Australian drama predicting Australian life post 2020 apocalyptic summer.","reviewBody":"If you like a slow burn (no insensitive pun intended) and want to look at what Australia might look like in the future after our scorching 2020 apocalyptic summer, then this is for you. Though this isn't about bushfires specifically, this is a post climate change driven saga that is pretty realistic - in a pretty scary way. Excellent character driven narrative around families, relationships, parenting, financial and racial divides, corruption, climate change, climate refugees, PTSD and traumas from just being alive as its all going down. One might think the writers had a crystal ball - it's pretty spot on and so well timed given that our entire continent is burning and that climate change is no longer some abstract futuristic theory, but something we are now living through, even in our cities. An enjoyable watch, some might find boring, possibly all the people that have reviewed this show thinking it's Lisa Macwhatsherface in the lead role (spoiler: it's not, and yes that British accent is real) - but this show really delivers in the last few episodes in season one. It's in your face about many subjects we like to shun - if you are after a non thought provoking, non challenging easy view, go watch something else, this is not for you. Touching a lot on the effects the changing climate has on young people and their narratives and responses around that, I found this helpful as a parent. Great all round production, futuristic but realistic visual, A1 cast portraying depth-full honest and challenging characters. If you liked Aussie drama Love my way, you will like this. A lot.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":514,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2019-12-25","keywords":"wanting to have a baby,climate change,female protagonist,melodrama,near future","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0296219/","name":"Joanne Froggatt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0672303/","name":"Rupert Penry-Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2256017/","name":"David Lyons"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0292799/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [EN]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3580346649","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTIwMTM1NzgtM2Q0Ni00NmJhLTljZmQtOGE0ZmM3OThlYTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTIwMTM1NzgtM2Q0Ni00NmJhLTljZmQtOGE0ZmM3OThlYTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 11324616, Title: The Commons, --- Description: The Commons: With Joanne Froggatt, Rupert Penry-Jones, David Lyons, Ryan Corr. Set in a gripping vision of the near future, THE COMMONS is an absorbing character-driven relationship drama and a story about motherhood as the ultimate act of faith in humanity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt11324616/","name":"The Commons","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNhYTdjMDQtOWE4YS00OTdhLTk3NGEtMDc0MGQwMzk3MjAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTE1NjY5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in a gripping vision of the near future, THE COMMONS is an absorbing character-driven relationship drama and a story about motherhood as the ultimate act of faith in humanity.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11324616/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"geeztell","dateCreated":"2020-01-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent Australian drama predicting Australian life post 2020 apocalyptic summer.","reviewBody":"If you like a slow burn (no insensitive pun intended) and want to look at what Australia might look like in the future after our scorching 2020 apocalyptic summer, then this is for you. Though this isn't about bushfires specifically, this is a post climate change driven saga that is pretty realistic - in a pretty scary way. Excellent character driven narrative around families, relationships, parenting, financial and racial divides, corruption, climate change, climate refugees, PTSD and traumas from just being alive as its all going down. One might think the writers had a crystal ball - it's pretty spot on and so well timed given that our entire continent is burning and that climate change is no longer some abstract futuristic theory, but something we are now living through, even in our cities. An enjoyable watch, some might find boring, possibly all the people that have reviewed this show thinking it's Lisa Macwhatsherface in the lead role (spoiler: it's not, and yes that British accent is real) - but this show really delivers in the last few episodes in season one. It's in your face about many subjects we like to shun - if you are after a non thought provoking, non challenging easy view, go watch something else, this is not for you. Touching a lot on the effects the changing climate has on young people and their narratives and responses around that, I found this helpful as a parent. Great all round production, futuristic but realistic visual, A1 cast portraying depth-full honest and challenging characters. If you liked Aussie drama Love my way, you will like this. A lot.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":514,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2019-12-25","keywords":"wanting to have a baby,climate change,female protagonist,melodrama,near future","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0296219/","name":"Joanne Froggatt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0672303/","name":"Rupert Penry-Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2256017/","name":"David Lyons"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0292799/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [EN]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3580346649","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTIwMTM1NzgtM2Q0Ni00NmJhLTljZmQtOGE0ZmM3OThlYTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTIwMTM1NzgtM2Q0Ni00NmJhLTljZmQtOGE0ZmM3OThlYTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 11324616, Title: The Commons, --- Description: The Commons: With Joanne Froggatt, Rupert Penry-Jones, David Lyons, Ryan Corr. Set in a gripping vision of the near future, THE COMMONS is an absorbing character-driven relationship drama and a story about motherhood as the ultimate act of faith in humanity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt11324616/","name":"The Commons","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNhYTdjMDQtOWE4YS00OTdhLTk3NGEtMDc0MGQwMzk3MjAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTE1NjY5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in a gripping vision of the near future, THE COMMONS is an absorbing character-driven relationship drama and a story about motherhood as the ultimate act of faith in humanity.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11324616/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"geeztell","dateCreated":"2020-01-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent Australian drama predicting Australian life post 2020 apocalyptic summer.","reviewBody":"If you like a slow burn (no insensitive pun intended) and want to look at what Australia might look like in the future after our scorching 2020 apocalyptic summer, then this is for you. Though this isn't about bushfires specifically, this is a post climate change driven saga that is pretty realistic - in a pretty scary way. Excellent character driven narrative around families, relationships, parenting, financial and racial divides, corruption, climate change, climate refugees, PTSD and traumas from just being alive as its all going down. One might think the writers had a crystal ball - it's pretty spot on and so well timed given that our entire continent is burning and that climate change is no longer some abstract futuristic theory, but something we are now living through, even in our cities. An enjoyable watch, some might find boring, possibly all the people that have reviewed this show thinking it's Lisa Macwhatsherface in the lead role (spoiler: it's not, and yes that British accent is real) - but this show really delivers in the last few episodes in season one. It's in your face about many subjects we like to shun - if you are after a non thought provoking, non challenging easy view, go watch something else, this is not for you. Touching a lot on the effects the changing climate has on young people and their narratives and responses around that, I found this helpful as a parent. Great all round production, futuristic but realistic visual, A1 cast portraying depth-full honest and challenging characters. If you liked Aussie drama Love my way, you will like this. A lot.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":514,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2019-12-25","keywords":"wanting to have a baby,climate change,female protagonist,melodrama,near future","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0296219/","name":"Joanne Froggatt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0672303/","name":"Rupert Penry-Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2256017/","name":"David Lyons"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0292799/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [EN]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3580346649","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTIwMTM1NzgtM2Q0Ni00NmJhLTljZmQtOGE0ZmM3OThlYTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTIwMTM1NzgtM2Q0Ni00NmJhLTljZmQtOGE0ZmM3OThlYTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent="

Set in a gripping vision of the near future, THE COMMONS is an absorbing character-driven relationship drama and a story about motherhood as the ultimate act of faith in humanity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt11324616/","name":"The Commons","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNhYTdjMDQtOWE4YS00OTdhLTk3NGEtMDc0MGQwMzk3MjAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTE1NjY5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in a gripping vision of the near future, THE COMMONS is an absorbing character-driven relationship drama and a story about motherhood as the ultimate act of faith in humanity.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11324616/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"geeztell"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent Australian drama predicting Australian life post 2020 apocalyptic summer.","reviewBody":"If you like a slow burn (no insensitive pun intended) and want to look at what Australia might look like in the future after our scorching 2020 apocalyptic summer, then this is for you. Though this isn't about bushfires specifically, this is a post climate change driven saga that is pretty realistic - in a pretty scary way. Excellent character driven narrative around families, relationships, parenting, financial and racial divides, corruption, climate change, climate refugees, PTSD and traumas from just being alive as its all going down. One might think the writers had a crystal ball - it's pretty spot on and so well timed given that our entire continent is burning and that climate change is no longer some abstract futuristic theory, but something we are now living through, even in our cities. An enjoyable watch, some might find boring, possibly all the people that have reviewed this show thinking it's Lisa Macwhatsherface in the lead role (spoiler: it's not, and yes that British accent is real) - but this show really delivers in the last few episodes in season one. It's in your face about many subjects we like to shun - if you are after a non thought provoking, non challenging easy view, go watch something else, this is not for you. Touching a lot on the effects the changing climate has on young people and their narratives and responses around that, I found this helpful as a parent. Great all round production, futuristic but realistic visual, A1 cast portraying depth-full honest and challenging characters. If you liked Aussie drama Love my way, you will like this. programme.category: Drama, Sci-Fi, Drama, Sci-Fi
programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 11324616, Title: The Commons, --- Description: The Commons: With Joanne Froggatt, Rupert Penry-Jones, David Lyons, Ryan Corr. Set in a gripping vision of the near future, THE COMMONS is an absorbing character-driven relationship drama and a story about motherhood as the ultimate act of faith in humanity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt11324616/","name":"The Commons","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNhYTdjMDQtOWE4YS00OTdhLTk3NGEtMDc0MGQwMzk3MjAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTE1NjY5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in a gripping vision of the near future, THE COMMONS is an absorbing character-driven relationship drama and a story about motherhood as the ultimate act of faith in humanity.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11324616/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"geeztell","dateCreated":"2020-01-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent Australian drama predicting Australian life post 2020 apocalyptic summer.","reviewBody":"If you like a slow burn (no insensitive pun intended) and want to look at what Australia might look like in the future after our scorching 2020 apocalyptic summer, then this is for you. Though this isn't about bushfires specifically, this is a post climate change driven saga that is pretty realistic - in a pretty scary way. Excellent character driven narrative around families, relationships, parenting, financial and racial divides, corruption, climate change, climate refugees, PTSD and traumas from just being alive as its all going down. One might think the writers had a crystal ball - it's pretty spot on and so well timed given that our entire continent is burning and that climate change is no longer some abstract futuristic theory, but something we are now living through, even in our cities. An enjoyable watch, some might find boring, possibly all the people that have reviewed this show thinking it's Lisa Macwhatsherface in the lead role (spoiler: it's not, and yes that British accent is real) - but this show really delivers in the last few episodes in season one. It's in your face about many subjects we like to shun - if you are after a non thought provoking, non challenging easy view, go watch something else, this is not for you. Touching a lot on the effects the changing climate has on young people and their narratives and responses around that, I found this helpful as a parent. Great all round production, futuristic but realistic visual, A1 cast portraying depth-full honest and challenging characters. If you liked Aussie drama Love my way, you will like this. A lot.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":514,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2019-12-25","keywords":"wanting to have a baby,climate change,female protagonist,melodrama,near future","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0296219/","name":"Joanne Froggatt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0672303/","name":"Rupert Penry-Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2256017/","name":"David Lyons"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0292799/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [EN]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3580346649","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTIwMTM1NzgtM2Q0Ni00NmJhLTljZmQtOGE0ZmM3OThlYTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTIwMTM1NzgtM2Q0Ni00NmJhLTljZmQtOGE0ZmM3OThlYTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Commons
The Commons
The Commons
programme.desc: The Commons: With Joanne Froggatt, Rupert Penry-Jones, David Lyons, Ryan Corr. Set in a gripping vision of the near future, THE COMMONS is an absorbing character-driven relationship drama and a story about motherhood as the ultimate act of faith in humanity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt11324616/","name":"The Commons","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNhYTdjMDQtOWE4YS00OTdhLTk3NGEtMDc0MGQwMzk3MjAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTE1NjY5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in a gripping vision of the near future, THE COMMONS is an absorbing character-driven relationship drama and a story about motherhood as the ultimate act of faith in humanity.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11324616/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"geeztell"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent Australian drama predicting Australian life post 2020 apocalyptic summer.","reviewBody":"If you like a slow burn (no insensitive pun intended) and want to look at what Australia might look like in the future after our scorching 2020 apocalyptic summer, then this is for you. Though this isn't about bushfires specifically, this is a post climate change driven saga that is pretty realistic - in a pretty scary way. Excellent character driven narrative around families, relationships, parenting, financial and racial divides, corruption, climate change, climate refugees, PTSD and traumas from just being alive as its all going down. One might think the writers had a crystal ball - it's pretty spot on and so well timed given that our entire continent is burning and that climate change is no longer some abstract futuristic theory, but something we are now living through, even in our cities. An enjoyable watch, some might find boring, possibly all the people that have reviewed this show thinking it's Lisa Macwhatsherface in the lead role (spoiler: it's not, and yes that British accent is real) - but this show really delivers in the last few episodes in season one. It's in your face about many subjects we like to shun - if you are after a non thought provoking, non challenging easy view, go watch something else, this is not for you. Touching a lot on the effects the changing climate has on young people and their narratives and responses around that, I found this helpful as a parent. Great all round production, futuristic but realistic visual, A1 cast portraying depth-full honest and challenging characters. If you liked Aussie drama Love my way, you will like this. A lot.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":514,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2019-12-25","keywords":"wanting to have a baby,climate change,female protagonist,melodrama,near future","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0296219/","name":"Joanne Froggatt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0672303/","name":"Rupert Penry-Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2256017/","name":"David Lyons"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0292799/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [EN]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3580346649","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTIwMTM1NzgtM2Q0Ni00NmJhLTljZmQtOGE0ZmM3OThlYTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTIwMTM1NzgtM2Q0Ni00NmJhLTljZmQtOGE0ZmM3OThlYTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

The Climb
programme.desc: The Climb: Directed by Michael Angelo Covino. With Kyle Marvin, Michael Angelo Covino, Gayle Rankin, Talia Balsam. A look at the friendship between two guys that spans over many years." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8637440/","name":"The Climb","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDczYjkxYzMtMGM2Yy00MDg0LWIwZGQtMjYwZWEzNDFmMzY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A look at the friendship between two guys that spans over many years.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8637440/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Friends ... how many others have them?","reviewBody":"Some friendships are quite special. Exhausting and terrible at times, but have worked for so many years that they may have developed a dangerous situation that both individuals may not be able to escape from ... but why would they want to you may ask? Is a great friend not everything you can ask for? Maybe and maybe not is the answer, I reckon.\n\nIn this case it is not just about friends, it is about what they do to each other and relationships outside their own one. Like with a life partner - not going to say they should share everything ... do not even think that. But you will see through family dysfunction and other oddities ... a low budget movie that can be quite engaging if you let it. Especially if you really roll with the flow of it and with the characters ... no matter how flawed they are .... and a movie that sort of almost ends like it begins ... with one friend not being able to control his emotions and ... well you'll see how others react to that! Not holding back "punches" - as I am not holding back on puns!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4044,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-11-13","keywords":"male nudity,cyclist,reference to batman,ice fishing,ice fishing hut","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi872464153","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2MwNjYzOWYtOGJhMC00YmI5LTlkZGYtMDZiYmZhZmM4YWMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2MwNjYzOWYtOGJhMC00YmI5LTlkZGYtMDZiYmZhZmM4YWMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Kyle and Mike are best friends who share a close bond ... until Mike sleeps with Kyle's fiancée."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5568803/","name":"Kyle Marvin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3511834/","name":"Michael Angelo Covino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4587360/","name":"Gayle Rankin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3511834/","name":"Michael Angelo Covino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0478896/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0742524/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251553/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3511834/","name":"Michael Angelo Covino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5568803/","name":"Kyle Marvin"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Pornografia
Pornografia
programme.desc:
Pornografia: Directed by Jan Jakub Kolski. With Krzysztof Majchrzak, Adam Ferency, Krzysztof Globisz, Grazyna Blecka-Kolska. Two intellectuals, a writer and a director, begin to play a mysterious psychological game in a peaceful countryside manor house during the Nazi occupation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0357037/","name":"Pornografia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyNTY3ODE2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODMwNTQ4Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two intellectuals, a writer and a director, begin to play a mysterious psychological game in a peaceful countryside manor house during the Nazi occupation.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0357037/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"scrypt@rcn.com"},"dateCreated":"2004-06-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ravishing attention to nuance; pity about the tone.","reviewBody":"Recently, I saw the film Pornografia at the Walter Reade Theater. This offering by Polish director Jan Kolski is an adaptation of Wiltold Gombrowicz's difficult novel, in which minute sensory information is invested with meaning and sutured into intricate causal patterns that reflect the protagonist's paranoia.

So much of the narrative takes place in the main character's head that I'd thought the story impossibly non-cinematic. Yet Kolski manages to bring in several levels of nuance and rarefied metaphor. What's more, said nuances become sensual and aesthetic. 

Unfortunately, what Kolski leaves out of the film is the tone of the book, which reads like Beckett's version of Dangerous Liaisons. The film feels too elegiac, too post-tragic, even overtly moralistic -- it's as if the director were trying to correct Gombrowicz's narrator's amoral tone. This change creates unintentional ambiguities, flaws that don't exist in the book: for example, it is unclear why the two main characters turn against one of younger characters in the story. In the film, the main characters seem too ethical, too sensitive, to behave as they do. In the novel, their cynicism and casual sadism are everywhere apparent.

In the theater, I perceived a number of Polish members of the audience to be weeping at key moments; it occurred to me that the loss of a son or daughter was so commonplace in that country at one time that the film might have had an indigenous impact -- one that a third- or second-generation American would miss without clarification. Thus I'm not ready to dismiss the film as unclear or sentimental without knowing more.

(For the record, neither the novel nor the film resembles Schindler's List; neither are about a concentration camp. And even if they were, Spielberg's melodrama is not the gold standard to which other holocaust films should be compared. Far earlier and better specimens exist, such as those by Louis Malle, Alain Resnais and Claude Lanzmann.)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":933,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance","War"],"datePublished":"2003-10-17","keywords":"sex standing up,lift skirt,panties hit the floor,panties pulled down,fondling","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538048/","name":"Krzysztof Majchrzak"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0272295/","name":"Adam Ferency"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322937/","name":"Krzysztof Globisz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0464383/","name":"Jan Jakub Kolski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043688/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094194/","name":"Luc Bondy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0102722/","name":"Gérard Brach"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0326822/","name":"Witold Gombrowicz"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: O co biega?
programme.desc: W magazynie nowinki oraz praktyczne porady dla osób, które uprawiają bieganie rekreacyjnie, półprofesjonalnie, zawodowo lub dopiero zaczynają. Gospodarz programu Marcin Rosłoń wraz z ekspertami będzie podpowiadał, jak przygotować się do biegania amatorskiego i zawodowego, jak dobrać odpowiedni sprzęt lub przygotować się do maratonu. W programie nie zabraknie również ciekawostek, rozmów ze sportowcami i osobami z show-biznesu, które opowiedzą o swojej pasji do biegania.

programme.title: Zmruz oczy
Zmruż oczy
programme.desc: Zmruz oczy: Directed by Andrzej Jakimowski. With Zbigniew Zamachowski, Olga Prószynska, Rafal Guzniczak, Malgorzata Foremniak. The story of a spirited ten-year-old girl who has run away from her proudly affluent parents in town and finds grudging refuge with the slightly slovenly caretaker of an abandoned farm, an ex-teacher." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0379063/","name":"Zmruz oczy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmZjNzhhNDYtMTg1YS00YWNjLTg0MjctNTY0Zjk1ZDEyZjk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjMwOTA0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of a spirited ten-year-old girl who has run away from her proudly affluent parents in town and finds grudging refuge with the slightly slovenly caretaker of an abandoned farm, an ex-teacher.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0379063/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nicholas-salerno"},"dateCreated":"2008-08-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A philosophical comedy","reviewBody":"Squint Your Eyes (Zmruz oczy), Poland, 2003, d. Andrzej Jaminowski, 87 m. When Jasiak, a retired school teacher, decides to act as custodian of a deserted farm in the Polish countryside, he finds the easy life more than he bargained for. To begin with, the farm's owners neither want nor need a custodian. Then his solitude is broken by one of his former students, a young girl who's had it with her materialistic parents. And by some con artists, some cyclists, at least one self-proclaimed poet, the girl's parents, the farm's owners, and ultimately the police. So much for lazy-ing around in the hazy countryside. You might call Squint Your Eyes a provocative, philosophical comedy.Nick Salerno","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":891,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2003-10-24","keywords":"farm,ex teacher,rural setting,unemployment,isolation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0952498/","name":"Zbigniew Zamachowski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1437136/","name":"Olga Prószynska"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1435653/","name":"Rafal Guzniczak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1435889/","name":"Andrzej Jakimowski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109608/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109606/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0126437/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1435889/","name":"Andrzej Jakimowski"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Le prince oublié: Directed by Michel Hazanavicius. With Omar Sy, Bérénice Bejo, François Damiens, Sarah Gaye. Every night as Sofia falls asleep, her father Djibi takes her into "Storyland", a fantasy film studio where their extraordinary fairy-tale adventures come to life starring Djibi in the lead role as the heroic Prince Charming." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8335482/","name":"Le prince oublié","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTJiZWEyNDMtNWNjOC00ZGJhLWExZjYtOTRhZmNlNjg0YzEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA3MzQ4MTc0._V1_.jpg","description":"Every night as Sofia falls asleep, her father Djibi takes her into "Storyland", a fantasy film studio where their extraordinary fairy-tale adventures come to life starring Djibi in the lead role as the heroic Prince Charming.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8335482/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jimimhendrix-31103"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Wonderful story about the circle of life","reviewBody":"8/10. I gave it a 10 because I think the current 5.1 is way too low

The story follows a single father very dedicated to provide a happy growing up experience to his daughter by way of storytelling. All is well until teenhood interferes, so both father and daughter have to learn to handle it :-)

The costumes in the story world are bright and happy. The real life story is honest but also positive.

I personally did not find anything wrong with the movie, it's message, its direction, its acting, etc.

The only reason I think it's an 8/10 is because of me: I'm a grown up and not a parent. Still I rated it 10/10 because I don't understand the current 5.1 rating. programme.title: Miasta rytm: Zrabowane dzieła sztuki
programme.desc: W trakcie II wojny światowej z Polski zniknęły setki tysięcy bezcennych dzieł sztuki. Zarówno niemieccy, jak i radzieccy okupanci masowo wywozili obrazy i rzeźby. Nie wszystkie udało się odzyskać. Obecnie wiele z tych polskich zbiorów rozsianych jest po całym świecie. Historyk sztuki Jerzy S. Majewski przybliża losy tych zrabowanych dóbr. Snuje opowieść o skradzionym dorobku wielu wspaniałych artystów i wyjaśnia, co się z nim dokładnie stało.

programme.title: The Descendants
Spadkobiercy
The Descendants
programme.desc:
The Descendants: Directed by Alexander Payne. With George Clooney, Shailene Woodley, Amara Miller, Nick Krause. A land baron tries to reconnect with his two daughters after his wife is seriously injured in a boating accident." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1033575/","name":"The Descendants","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyNTA1MTcyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjEyODczNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A land baron tries to reconnect with his two daughters after his wife is seriously injured in a boating accident.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1033575/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red_Identity"},"dateCreated":"2012-01-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty excellent, but definitely sort of odd","reviewBody":"I never really had high expectations for The Descendants. First off, I have never seen an Alexander Payne film, and the story itself sort of seemed like the type of film that would end up on a long list of solid films that end up being unmemorable. Much to my surprise, it has a sort of tone that you don't see often in these types of films.

This is a film that carefully treads around the edges. I wouldn't say it ever became too sentimental. Yet I also expected a snappy dialogue- filled, fast-paced dramedy, sort of like Reitman's Up in the Air, that other Clooney film. The film is written and plays out like a real life situation. One could maybe try to say that about any film like this, but here it rings true. To say it's slow or fast paced isn't really what matters, but what matters is how much it develops its characters with real richness and detail. In a way, the screenplay is helped a lot by Payne as a director, not because the writing is thin, but because the direction allows the film to feel sort of spontaneous. This isn't a film full of twists or turns, and yet at every corner when you try to analyze it, you realize how unpredictable it all feels. 

I have also heard one thing about it in many reviews, and that is how it's messy like life. One can easily read those descriptions and just roll his or her eyes, but that description really holds truth. The film doesn't feel to glamorous or stylized. It certainly isn't the dramedy with witty one liners that I expected. Instead, when it's all over, you take a step back and realize that it all feels sort of messy. It's not complicated, and in fact it's a pretty simple film, but even the editing helps this certain mood that the film leaves you in. It's simple, yet hard to really pinpoint and describe how it all comes together or how it's something of real importance. This is completely refreshing, especially when films these days hammer you with these sort of messages or details.

I now want to talk about the performances, which are stellar. Clooney just won the Globe a couple of hours ago, and now I look at it and think to myself "wow... of all of his performances, this is getting him awards?". It's a very restrained performance, and no, it isn't a transformation. Some will once again say that Clooney is only "playing himself", but to me, when Clooney does great, he really nails it. He gives all of his performances something distinct about them, and this is perhaps his wild-card character. He doesn't add in his usual smoothness that we see a lot from him. This stands apart, and I am surprised for that reason for its success. Shailene Woodley is fantastic here as well, and really impressed me with the sort of indignation and maturity that she mixes together. She's better than most of the contenders for the Oscar in her category, more specifically Octavia Spencer, Melissa McCarthy, and Janet McTeer.

I loved this film. I wasn't sure of it while I was seeing it, but after it's over, as hard as it is to really describe and know why I enjoyed it so much, I did. The sort of atmosphere and mood that it had me in doesn't come along very often, especially not with dramas like this."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":236597,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2011-12-09","keywords":"father daughter relationship,boating accident,hawaii,cheating wife,dying mother","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4144471577","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1NzQ4Mzc5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjcyMTkwNw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1NzQ4Mzc5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjcyMTkwNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A land baron tries to re-connect with his two daughters after his wife suffers a boating accident. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0940362/","name":"Shailene Woodley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3837786/","name":"Amara Miller"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028932/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0171502/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269542/","name":"Nat Faxon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0711110/","name":"Jim Rash"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Radioactive
Skłodowska
Radioactive
programme.desc:
Radioactive: Directed by Marjane Satrapi. With Rosamund Pike, Yvette Feuer, Mirjam Novak, Ralph Berkin. The incredible true story of Marie Sklodowska-Curie and her Nobel Prize-winning work that changed the world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6017756/","name":"Radioactive","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGZkNzY3MmUtYjJlNC00NTM0LWFiNmYtZDA4NzBiMmU1MzI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE0OTU5Nzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The incredible true story of Marie Sklodowska-Curie and her Nobel Prize-winning work that changed the world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6017756/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tm-sheehan"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dull Script & Direction Great performance by Rosamund Pike","reviewBody":"My Review- Radioactive (Prime Amazon) My rating 6/10

My 6/10 rating is for the film itself Rosamund Pike gets an 8:10 for her performance as Marie Curie the famous Nobel Winning Scientist who discovered the elements of Polinium and Radium.

She marries and forms a partnership with her husband Pierre (Sam Riley ) who also gives a fine performance in a very flawed script apparently filled with inaccuracies to add to the drama but in my view only adds to the dullness of this movie.

"Rotten Tomatoes " though similar to me "Radioactive's flawed script and counterproductive storytelling choices are offset by Rosamund Pike's central performance in a sincere tribute to a brilliant scientific mind.

The film is based on the graphic novel ''Radioactive: Marie & Pierre Curie: A Tale of Love and Fallout'' by Lauren Redniss. This is director Marjane Satrapi's first film based on a graphic novel that was not written by her. I think that is very obvious and shows her inexperience . The Screenplay by Jack Thorne is just dull and uninteresting I'm sure the book it's based on must be better.

There are intrusive and unnecessary and distracting references to the future effects of Marie Curie's contributions to Science depicting the future impact of her discoveries, including external beam radiotherapy at a hospital in Cleveland in 1956, the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, a nuclear bomb test in Nevada in 1961, and the Chernobyl disaster in 1986 it gives the impression or perhaps message that perhaps humanity may have been better off without her great discoveries?

Both the Curies experienced radium burns, both accidentally and voluntarily, and were exposed to extensive doses of radiation while conducting their research. They experienced radiation sickness and Marie Curie died of aplastic anemia in 1934. Even now, all their papers from the 1890s, even her cookbooks, are too dangerous to touch. Their laboratory books are kept in special lead boxes and people who want to see them have to wear protective clothing. Had Pierre Curie not been killed as he was, it is likely that he would have eventually died of the effects of radiation, as did his wife, their daughter Irène, and her husband Frédéric Joliot.

I'm a great fan of Rosamund Pike and enjoyed her performance in this very dull average film I suggest read the book or watch the far superior 1943 film with Greer Garson "Madam Curie." and Walter Pidgeon as Pierre.

It was nominated for 7 Oscars and a much better film directed by Mervyn LeRoy and based on Ève Curie the daughter of Madam Curie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15015,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-06-15","keywords":"scientist,physicist,science,physics,chemistry","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1577631257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxMzMxYWQtZjM5Mi00ZGYzLTgyNzUtZWFjNDQ5NTliYjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxMzMxYWQtZjM5Mi00ZGYzLTgyNzUtZWFjNDQ5NTliYjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"A story of the scientific and romantic passions of Marie Sklodowska-Curie (Polish scientist) and Pierre Curie, and the reverberation of their discoveries throughout the 20th century."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0683253/","name":"Rosamund Pike"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275431/","name":"Yvette Feuer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1597296/","name":"Mirjam Novak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2277869/","name":"Marjane Satrapi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2113666/","name":"Jack Thorne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9706688/","name":"Lauren Redniss"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Official Secrets
Brudna gra
Official Secrets
programme.desc:
Official Secrets: Directed by Gavin Hood. With Keira Knightley, Matt Smith, Matthew Goode, Rhys Ifans. The true story of a British whistleblower who leaked information to the press about an illegal NSA spy operation designed to push the UN Security Council into sanctioning the 2003 invasion of Iraq." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5431890/","name":"Official Secrets","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjY1NWYwZmEtNGE3Ny00YTZhLThmZTMtNGI2MDY0MGU5YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY3Nzc0OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"The true story of a British whistleblower who leaked information to the press about an illegal NSA spy operation designed to push the UN Security Council into sanctioning the 2003 invasion of Iraq.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5431890/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"agmoldham"},"dateCreated":"2019-10-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Really Enjoyable","reviewBody":"Official Secrets studies the events that are happening in intelligence during the run up to the second gulf war. Having lived through the times myself was aware of the background to the movie, but unaware of the specific story that it explores.

Keira Knightly plays Katharine Gun who works at GCHQ collecting intelligence for the UK. She is concerned about the accuracy of the intelligence that is being used to prove the case for war. The British and American government need a resolution passing at the United Nations to legitimize the war. A memo is distributed to collect intelligence on the United Nations members that can be used to coax them into voting for the resolution. She is shocked by this and wants to stop the war.

In the same way that Brexit dominates British news at the moment WMD's dominated the next back then. The movie is good and shows the pressure that everybody is under. You get the chance to wonder whether you would make the same decisions as Katharine and whether she was right to do it.

I've never been a big fan of Knightly, but she does a fine job in Official Secrets. Well worth a watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":40534,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-08-30","keywords":"whistleblower,courtroom,cafe,british politics,spy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4129995801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWE3Njg0NjctOTk0ZC00YjNjLWI5OGEtMWMyYmI4YTFhZWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWE3Njg0NjctOTk0ZC00YjNjLWI5OGEtMWMyYmI4YTFhZWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Katharine Gun (Keira Knightley), a British intelligence specialist whose job involves routine handling of classified information. One day in 2003, in the lead up to the Iraq War, Gun receives a memo from the NSA with a shocking directive: the United States is enlisting Britain's help in collecting compromising information on United Nations Security Council members in order to blackmail them into voting in favor of an invasion of Iraq. Unable to stand by and watch the world be rushed into an illegal war, Gun makes the decision to defy her government and leak the memo to the press. So begins an explosive chain of events that will ignite an international firestorm, expose a vast political conspiracy, and put Gun and her family directly in harm's way."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461136/","name":"Keira Knightley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1741002/","name":"Matt Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0328828/","name":"Matthew Goode"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004303/","name":"Gavin Hood"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0760923/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0681278/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077135/","name":"Sara Bernstein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077052/","name":"Gregory Bernstein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004303/","name":"Gavin Hood"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Downhill
Zjazd
Downhill
programme.desc:
Downhill: Directed by Nat Faxon, Jim Rash. With Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Will Ferrell, Zach Woods, Zoe Chao. Barely escaping an avalanche during a family ski vacation in the Alps, a married couple is thrown into disarray as they are forced to reevaluate their lives and how they feel about each other." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4558376/","name":"Downhill","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2QxMWFlOTktNWY0Mi00MDQ5LWExMTYtNThjZTFhNGZkZjk1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Barely escaping an avalanche during a family ski vacation in the Alps, a married couple is thrown into disarray as they are forced to reevaluate their lives and how they feel about each other.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4558376/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"context-91247"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"How do you clear out a movie theater? Play Downhill.","reviewBody":"The ratings on here are primarily 1's and 2's. That's being generous. I see that it has a single 7-star rating, so clearly some first-time Production Assistant's blindly proud mom is on IMDb.

Literally, 30 minutes in, people started walking out. Primarily women! I've never seen so many people walk out of a movie. When it was over, people on both sides of us and in front of us were complaining to each other about how depressing, boring, and stupid the whole experience was. Everyone was annoyed & felt like they had lost 90 minutes.

I wanted to walk out, too, but I held out, believing that there had to be some sort of redeeming event at the end. Nope. Just misery. Boring, painful misery. It literally felt like I paid good money to sit in on some crappy couple's depressing therapy session for 90 minutes. Absolutely no entertainment value. Absolutely detestable characters. I didn't want to root for them for the first 15 minutes, and I didn't give a crap about them from minute 16 on. I just wanted them to divorce or die so I could go home.

Pure misery.

The acting was mediocre and unbelievable at best. Mostly because they had NO material to work with. No laughs. Not one. I heard one or two quiet mumbles during the movie, but they may have been restrained coughs.

I generally like these actors, but unfortunately, I think the title is a pretty firm, bold, and prophetic description of their career trajectories after this terrible train wreck.

If you have the option between watching this movie or dying slowly and miserably in an avalanche, take the avalanche."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11162,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-02-14","keywords":"remake,snow,ski,vacation,married couple","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"UK Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi542883609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmUyMTYzNWItNmIwMS00ZTVkLWJmZTgtZGQ3MzJhOWFhOWQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmUyMTYzNWItNmIwMS00ZTVkLWJmZTgtZGQ3MzJhOWFhOWQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Things go off-piste for a married couple on a family vacation in the Alps. An avalanche leads to some drastic decisions with uncomfortable consequences. Julia Louis-Dreyfus and Will Ferrell star in this biting dark comedy. IMDb data; ttnr: 4558376, Title: Downhill, --- Description: Downhill: Directed by Nat Faxon, Jim Rash. With Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Will Ferrell, Zach Woods, Zoe Chao. Barely escaping an avalanche during a family ski vacation in the Alps, a married couple is thrown into disarray as they are forced to reevaluate their lives and how they feel about each other." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4558376/","name":"Downhill","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2QxMWFlOTktNWY0Mi00MDQ5LWExMTYtNThjZTFhNGZkZjk1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Barely escaping an avalanche during a family ski vacation in the Alps, a married couple is thrown into disarray as they are forced to reevaluate their lives and how they feel about each other.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4558376/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"context-91247","dateCreated":"2020-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"How do you clear out a movie theater? Play Downhill.","reviewBody":"The ratings on here are primarily 1's and 2's. That's being generous. I see that it has a single 7-star rating, so clearly some first-time Production Assistant's blindly proud mom is on IMDb.

Literally, 30 minutes in, people started walking out. Primarily women! I've never seen so many people walk out of a movie. When it was over, people on both sides of us and in front of us were complaining to each other about how depressing, boring, and stupid the whole experience was. Everyone was annoyed & felt like they had lost 90 minutes.

I wanted to walk out, too, but I held out, believing that there had to be some sort of redeeming event at the end. Nope. Just misery. Boring, painful misery. It literally felt like I paid good money to sit in on some crappy couple's depressing therapy session for 90 minutes. Absolutely no entertainment value. Absolutely detestable characters. I didn't want to root for them for the first 15 minutes, and I didn't give a crap about them from minute 16 on. I just wanted them to divorce or die so I could go home.

Pure misery.

The acting was mediocre and unbelievable at best. Mostly because they had NO material to work with. No laughs. Not one. I heard one or two quiet mumbles during the movie, but they may have been restrained coughs.

I generally like these actors, but unfortunately, I think the title is a pretty firm, bold, and prophetic description of their career trajectories after this terrible train wreck.

If you have the option between watching this movie or dying slowly and miserably in an avalanche, take the avalanche.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11162,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-02-14","keywords":"remake,snow,ski,vacation,married couple","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"UK Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi542883609","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmUyMTYzNWItNmIwMS00ZTVkLWJmZTgtZGQ3MzJhOWFhOWQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmUyMTYzNWItNmIwMS00ZTVkLWJmZTgtZGQ3MzJhOWFhOWQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Things go off-piste for a married couple on a family vacation in the Alps. programme.title: Stealing Harvard
Pianista
The Pianist
programme.desc: Stealing Harvard: Directed by Bruce McCulloch. With Jason Lee, Tom Green, Leslie Mann, Megan Mullally. A middle-class man turns to a life of crime in order to finance his niece's first year at Harvard University." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0265808/","name":"Stealing Harvard","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjZhMGIyNGMtN2NmYy00OTBhLWE3NWQtMGQ3ZmNmZGUwMDg1L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A middle-class man turns to a life of crime in order to finance his niece's first year at Harvard University.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0265808/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MLDinTN"},"dateCreated":"2003-09-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"a silly comedy that works","reviewBody":"Call me crazy, but I liked this movie. It had its moments. I especially liked Elaine's dad; his character was the funniest. The part where John and Mr. Warner end up in drag at the judge's house was so funny. Then the end was great when John writes I have the picture, and the judge lets him off. And all the silly ideas John and Duff come up with to get the money were quite entertaining. I liked the fact that for once, Tom Green didn't play a gross out character.\n\nFINAL VERDICT: This is a comedy worth seeing. programme.title: Trzy i pół godziny
programme.desc: Monachium, 13 sierpnia 1961 roku. Pasażerowie pociągu do Berlina Wschodniego dowiadują się o budowie muru dzielącego miasto. Do granicy dotrą za trzy i pół godziny. W tym czasie muszą podjąć decyzję, czy wysiąść, czy jechać dalej. Przed trudnym wyborem staje m.in. Marlis podróżująca z mężem Gerdem i dzieckiem.

programme.title: Military Wives
Pojedynek na głosy
Military Wives
programme.desc:
Military Wives: Directed by Peter Cattaneo. With Kristin Scott Thomas, Sharon Horgan, Emma Lowndes, Gaby French. With their partners away serving in Afghanistan, a group of women on the home front form a choir and quickly find themselves at the center of a media sensation and global movement." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8951692/","name":"Military Wives","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWUxZGJkNjgtMDFjMC00ZTFiLTlmMGMtZGZmNWY4N2FlOWE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTI4MzE4MDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"With their partners away serving in Afghanistan, a group of women on the home front form a choir and quickly find themselves at the center of a media sensation and global movement.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8951692/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"iamkeysersoze-13228"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not perfect but still worth watching","reviewBody":"Military Wives is as formulaic as movies go, regardless the film is surprisingly good and it uses the formula really well. However it never aspires to be anything else preventing it from becoming a classic amongst the genre.

I haven't been familiar with the true story but from the start, you just know where it is all gonna go. It still works well but nothing is a surprise because of that. It still has some great moments and a fair amount of heart

It is seriously enjoyable and it is a likeable movie with a great cast. Kristen Scott Thomas and Sharon Horgan are great here. I'm sure there are many people who will like this film. I just can't see that much greatness in it. It's formulaic and does it's best to be a lovely and charming film but it does it in such a manipulative way, and I hate it when films do that. It is still worth watching though"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4325,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2020-03-06","keywords":"friendship,singing,bus,drinking,bar","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4201561881","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTRkODczMzQtNDJjZS00ZjU0LTk3NTctZDMwNmM2MzViMTZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTRkODczMzQtNDJjZS00ZjU0LTk3NTctZDMwNmM2MzViMTZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000218/","name":"Kristin Scott Thomas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1279721/","name":"Sharon Horgan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1266378/","name":"Emma Lowndes"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146341/","name":"Peter Cattaneo"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0407896/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0209925/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0784476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2074041/","name":"Rachel Tunnard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1598473/","name":"Rosanne Flynn"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

La daronne
programme.desc: La daronne: Directed by Jean-Paul Salomé. With Isabelle Huppert, Hippolyte Girardot, Farida Ouchani, Liliane Rovère. A translator working for the police gets involved in the other side of drug dealing." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9288726/","name":"La daronne","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQxYjNiOGYtZDNiOC00OWY2LTkxNjQtY2VhODYzNDk5ZjE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDU0NjMyNTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A translator working for the police gets involved in the other side of drug dealing.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9288726/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Getting it","reviewBody":"Isabelle Huppert - just the name alone should be enough for some to not even think twice about how they will feel about this movie. And she is really getting it - well done. Now morally speaking there are things that will be going on, that not everyone will agree with. Maybe that is the wrong way of putting it. But you'll know what I mean when you see the movie (or even the trailer I assume).\n\nThe movie is very well thought of and is quite the entertaining ride - while the subject matter is serious and there are certain scenes that are on the violent side - overall the tone is that of a comedy. Acting overall is top notch, there are certain things that may feel like an easy way out (problems that almost literally disappear to a degree) ... and the ending is something that while nice, is nothing that is as amazing or gives the movie an extra push ... but maybe that is nitpicking. Just enjoy the thriller ride with a lot of laughs (and still some social message hidden in there)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1950,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-09-09","keywords":"female translator,female drug dealer,retirement home,wind turbine,police","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2064367385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFlNjk4ZDAtMjRiNC00M2Q4LTk3MzktNDM4N2Q5MmRjYTE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFlNjk4ZDAtMjRiNC00M2Q4LTk3MzktNDM4N2Q5MmRjYTE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001376/","name":"Isabelle Huppert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320762/","name":"Hippolyte Girardot"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1560551/","name":"Farida Ouchani"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0758933/","name":"Jean-Paul Salomé"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056792/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0690980/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0230609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1163751/","name":"Hannelore Cayre"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0758933/","name":"Jean-Paul Salomé"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3854210/","name":"Antoine Salomé"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

A translator working for the police gets involved in the other side of drug dealing." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9288726/","name":"La daronne","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQxYjNiOGYtZDNiOC00OWY2LTkxNjQtY2VhODYzNDk5ZjE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDU0NjMyNTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A translator working for the police gets involved in the other side of drug dealing.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9288726/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp","dateCreated":"2020-10-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Getting it","reviewBody":"Isabelle Huppert - just the name alone should be enough for some to not even think twice about how they will feel about this movie. And she is really getting it - well done. Now morally speaking there are things that will be going on, that not everyone will agree with. Maybe that is the wrong way of putting it. But you'll know what I mean when you see the movie (or even the trailer I assume).\n\nThe movie is very well thought of and is quite the entertaining ride - while the subject matter is serious and there are certain scenes that are on the violent side - overall the tone is that of a comedy. Acting overall is top notch, there are certain things that may feel like an easy way out (problems that almost literally disappear to a degree) ... and the ending is something that while nice, is nothing that is as amazing or gives the movie an extra push ... but maybe that is nitpicking. programme.title: 25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy
25 lat niewinności. Sprawa Tomka Komendy
programme.desc:
25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy: Directed by Jan Holoubek. With Piotr Trojan, Agata Kulesza, Dariusz Chojnacki, Jan Frycz. The ordinary life of Tomasz Komenda is turned upside down when he is wrongly accused of brutal murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11368998/","name":"25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2E3YWNhMTgtMzRiZS00N2UxLWJkYzEtOGYyMWFhNDhlZmExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The ordinary life of Tomasz Komenda is turned upside down when he is wrongly accused of brutal murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11368998/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"v-26640"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A powerful movie about how person can be sentenced on circumstantial evidences.","reviewBody":"Tomasz Komenda was sentenced about 3 years after the crime had been committed basing on simple idea - 'find me a man and we fill forge evidences against him'. What this move does not show is that at that time Attorney General, now deceased Lech Kaczynski had been urged that a killer is found and sentenced to silence medias hysteria and coverage about brutal murder and rape of that young girl. Later when the murder was put on Tomasz, he was publicly defamed by Lech Kaczynski. Despite Mr L. Kaczynski death in Smolensk plane crash and after Tomasz was exonerated, no polish public institution nor police have never apologized Tomasz for their actions, which is a standard practice in western democratic countries.

Not much changed in post-soviet bloc however after 1990 in terms of judiciary mentality. Human Rights Watch estimates that 1-3% of sentences in Poland may be those in which innocent people are sentenced just because either suspects were threatened by police to force to confess by beatings. No effective police control and their procedures exists as of today. You may call it a mafia or not but I believe it's not far from truth in Poland.

Personally I believe his family did not do enough to get him out of prison, a good lawyer would smash the case easily and he is worth every money, why did it happen 15 years later is a mystery for me.

As Tomasz said after his release, there are no good people in prisons , there is only evil.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":829,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-09-18","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3825975/","name":"Piotr Trojan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0474492/","name":"Agata Kulesza"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2621963/","name":"Dariusz Chojnacki"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1450132/","name":"Jan Holoubek"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0015575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0185099/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1733303/","name":"Andrzej Golda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1450132/","name":"Jan Holoubek"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Rozdroze Cafe: Directed by Leszek Wosiewicz. With Robert Olech, Piotr Glowacki, Cezary Lukaszewicz, Martyna Peszko." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0479261/","name":"Rozdroze Cafe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGJjYTU2NWQtZmUzNy00YTA5LWE3NWMtZDUzNzhiYTIyMGQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479261/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"temporarybobi"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well done","reviewBody":"I saw this film in Krakow's Kino Pod Baranami. Film was well done. It depicts the misunderstandings among some young polish provincial people, who have the ambitions to crop up in the new post-communist, re-capitalist society.

While the young women in the film are trying to escape the disconsolately life by either getting know established oldsters or by giving birth to numerous children, the young men decide to rob a bank. Things get wrong, one of the guys flips out and kills four people.

The film is supposed to be based on a true story which has happened for about 3-4 years in Warsaw. The screenplay makes use of many clichés, otherwise film is well done."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":142,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-11-11","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2027064/","name":"Robert Olech"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1644158/","name":"Piotr Glowacki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2021835/","name":"Cezary Lukaszewicz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0941829/","name":"Leszek Wosiewicz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0941829/","name":"Leszek Wosiewicz"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Operacja Koza

Wiera is a beautiful and well-trained agent of the former KGB, sent to Poland to steal the young genius's potion. programme.title: Robin's Wish
Dzień dobry, Robin
Robin's Wish
programme.desc:
Robin's Wish: Directed by Tylor Norwood. With Susan Schneider, Bruce Miller, Walter Koroshetz, Mike Mullen. An intimate portrait of Robin Williams and his invulnerable spirit, Robin's Wish is the story of what really happened to one of the greatest entertainers of all time - and what his mind was fighting." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12763474/","name":"Robin's Wish","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjY5MzdiOGQtY2IwNC00Njg0LWIwNWEtNmJjMGRjNzJiMWU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An intimate portrait of Robin Williams and his invulnerable spirit, Robin's Wish is the story of what really happened to one of the greatest entertainers of all time - and what his mind was fighting.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12763474/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"maccas-56367"},"dateCreated":"2021-07-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"A beatiful documentary and touching tribute","reviewBody":"A beautiful documentary in memory of Robin Williams. It doubles as both a touching tribute by those who loved him most, and an awareness piece on Lewy Bodies Dementia.

I was definitely left with a good idea about the kind of person Robin was outside of his films. His talents are featured here, but it's more about him as a person and the film is all the better for it.

It doesn't shy from the tragic nature of Lewy Bodies, and I learned a lot about it I didn't know. The anecdotes from Robin's neighbours and closest friends were touching and a nice break from the dark tragedy of his illness.

The love story of Robin and his wife was what I loved most. When combined with stories of Robin's time entertaining troops and visiting people in hospital, you're left with an inspiring, uplifting film.

For all its darkness, it manages (quite fittingly) some essential laughs too. It ends on a really beautiful note and gets you thinking about life itself and what truly matters most.

RIP Robin.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1450,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"genre":["Documentary","Biography"],"datePublished":"2020-09-01","keywords":"suicide,death,comedian,robin williams,archive footage","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Robin's Wish","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1018347801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiNDE4OTktYTkzMi00NjhmLWFlZjktMDE0YjYyNzk4ZDZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiNDE4OTktYTkzMi00NjhmLWFlZjktMDE0YjYyNzk4ZDZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6699367/","name":"Susan Schneider"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506613/","name":"Shawn Levy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5985170/","name":"John R. Montgomery"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3790611/","name":"Tylor Norwood"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0812160/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3790611/","name":"Tylor Norwood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4375465/","name":"Scott Fitzloff"}],"duration":"PT1H17M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 12763474, Title: Robin's Wish, --- Description: Robin's Wish: Directed by Tylor Norwood. With Susan Schneider, Bruce Miller, Walter Koroshetz, Mike Mullen. An intimate portrait of Robin Williams and his invulnerable spirit, Robin's Wish is the story of what really happened to one of the greatest entertainers of all time - and what his mind was fighting." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12763474/","name":"Robin's Wish","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjY5MzdiOGQtY2IwNC00Njg0LWIwNWEtNmJjMGRjNzJiMWU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An intimate portrait of Robin Williams and his invulnerable spirit, Robin's Wish is the story of what really happened to one of the greatest entertainers of all time - and what his mind was fighting.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12763474/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"maccas-56367","dateCreated":"2021-07-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"A beatiful documentary and touching tribute","reviewBody":"A beautiful documentary in memory of Robin Williams. It doubles as both a touching tribute by those who loved him most, and an awareness piece on Lewy Bodies Dementia.

I was definitely left with a good idea about the kind of person Robin was outside of his films. His talents are featured here, but it's more about him as a person and the film is all the better for it.

It doesn't shy from the tragic nature of Lewy Bodies, and I learned a lot about it I didn't know. The anecdotes from Robin's neighbours and closest friends were touching and a nice break from the dark tragedy of his illness.

The love story of Robin and his wife was what I loved most. When combined with stories of Robin's time entertaining troops and visiting people in hospital, you're left with an inspiring, uplifting film.

For all its darkness, it manages (quite fittingly) some essential laughs too. It ends on a really beautiful note and gets you thinking about life itself and what truly matters most.

RIP Robin.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1450,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3,"genre":["Documentary","Biography"],"datePublished":"2020-09-01","keywords":"suicide,death,comedian,robin williams,archive footage","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Robin's Wish","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1018347801","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiNDE4OTktYTkzMi00NjhmLWFlZjktMDE0YjYyNzk4ZDZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiNDE4OTktYTkzMi00NjhmLWFlZjktMDE0YjYyNzk4ZDZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6699367/","name":"Susan Schneider","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506613/","name":"Shawn Levy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5985170/","name":"John R.
